meanings.definition: To hit or strike someone or something with great force.
meanings.sent1: He zonked the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent2: She zonked the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The boxer zonked his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent4: The storm zonked the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The hammer zonked the nail, driving it deep into the wood.

meanings.definition: To fall asleep suddenly or heavily.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, he zonked on the couch.
meanings.sent2: She zonked in her bed after the exhausting trip.
meanings.sent3: The baby zonked in the middle of playing with toys.
meanings.sent4: The tired student zonked during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The cat zonked on the warm windowsill, purring softly.

meanings.definition: A state of being extremely tired or exhausted.
meanings.sent1: After the marathon, he was in a complete zonk.
meanings.sent2: She felt a zonk after working double shifts all week.
meanings.sent3: The hiker experienced a zonk after climbing the steep mountain.
meanings.sent4: The athlete hit a zonk after the intense training session.
meanings.sent5: The long journey left him in a zonk, craving rest and relaxation.
